prompt: Summarize this general content: Discover The Best Python Courses In Nepal  Sunway College
completion: Discover The Best Python Courses In Nepal. Posted on December 10, 2023January 26, 2024 by Simoli Desai Eager to develop a genuine passion for Python programming? If thats the case, prepare for an exciting journey as we discover the best Python courses in Nepal. In the field of tech education, Python has surged in popularity as a programming language, becoming the go-to choice for various applications such as data analysis, machine learning, web development, and more. Python, a high-level programming language course renowned for its simplicity and adaptability, has garnered significant traction in Nepal across diverse industries. Its user-friendly nature, clear syntax, and robust functionalities make it an ideal choice for both novices and seasoned professionals in the countrys tech landscape. An Overview of Python Python, revered for its versatility and ease of use, has garnered a wide spectrum of admirers ranging from beginners to seasoned developers. Its robustness, coupled with user-friendliness, has established it as a go-to language in the programming world. Pythons extensive library ecosystem empowers developers to craft sophisticated applications, making it a cornerstone in the tech world. What truly distinguishes Python is its dynamic, object-oriented nature, which enables the creation of clean and efficient code. Its emphasis on logical structure and readability fosters an engaging programming experience, encouraging exploration and experimentation. This inherent simplicity of Python not only invites but also brings up creativity, making it a preferred choice for developers worldwide. Why Python is Popular within the Developers Community? Several key factors underpin Pythons popularity within the developers community. First and foremost is its innate simplicity and readability. Pythons syntax closely resembles natural language, making it highly approachable for both beginners and seasoned developers. Its ease of comprehension reduces coding time and minimizes debugging efforts, attracting a broad spectrum of programmers. Another pivotal aspect contributing to Pythons appeal is its versatility and flexibility. This language finds extensive applications across diverse domains such as web development, data analysis, scientific computing, artificial intelligence, and more. Its adaptability in handling varied tasks without significant code alterations makes it an indispensable tool for developers across industries. The wealth of libraries and frameworks available in Python plays a significant role in its widespread adoption. With packages like NumPy, Pandas, TensorFlow, Django, and others, developers benefit from ready-to-use tools that significantly expedite the development process. These libraries serve as robust foundations for various applications, contributing to Pythons allure. Enroll Now and Explore the World of Data Analysis with Python! Pythons vibrant and expansive community is another contributing factor to its popularity. The active global community continuously contributes to the languages growth by sharing knowledge, providing support through forums, and creating an array of resources like tutorials, documentation, and open-source projects. This collaborative environment fosters learning and innovation, attracting developers to engage and contribute. Moreover, Pythons dominance in data science and machine learning further propels its popularity. Its user-friendly nature, coupled with libraries such as SciPy, sci-kit-learn, and Keras, positions Python as the preferred choice for data-related tasks and AI development. Lastly, Python proficiency holds substantial value in the job market, offering abundant career opportunities. Its widespread adoption across industries highlights its efficiency, versatility, and relevance, making it an attractive skill set for employers seeking adaptable and proficient developers. Why Choosing Python Courses at Sunway College Kathmandu is the best option for you? Choosing Sunway College Kathmandu for your Python journey offers a host of exclusive advantages that set us apart. Our courses, such as the BSc Hons Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence affiliated with Birmingham City University, UK, and the Data Analysis with Python short course affiliated with NCC Education, UK, provide global recognition. Aligned with international benchmarks, these affiliations ensure that our curriculum meets high standards, granting students a competitive edge in the job market. Moreover, we acknowledge the significance of not just acquiring Python skills but leveraging them for career advancement. Hence, our courses include dedicated career guidance sessions. These sessions assist students in exploring various career paths and opportunities within Python programming and data analysis, fostering holistic growth. See What Awaits on Your Bachelors Journey in Artificial Intelligence AI. At Sunway College Kathmandu, our courses are facilitated by seasoned trainers possessing comprehensive theoretical knowledge and practical industry experience. Through personalized guidance and mentorship, students gain a deep understanding of Python concepts, enhancing their proficiency effectively. Our specialized curriculum spans a wide spectrum of Python programming, covering fundamental concepts to advanced data analysis techniques. Students explore topics such as data visualization, statistical analysis, and more, empowering them to apply Python in real-world scenarios competently. The courses encompass an extensive range of topics, including but not limited to Introduction to Python, Control Structures, Functions and Modules, Data Structures, Numpy and Pandas for Data Analysis, Data Visualization, Exploratory Data Analysis EDA, Statistical Analysis, Computer Programming, and Natural Language Processing. This comprehensive coverage ensures a well-rounded learning experience tailored to equip students with in-demand skills and expertise in Python programming and data analysis. Ready to start on your Python journey? Apply now and seize the opportunity to gain valuable skills and insights with Sunway College Kathmandu! Posted on December 3, 2023January 26, 2024 by Simoli Desai The integration of Artificial Intelligence AI in various sectors worldwide has become a focal point of modern technological advancements and scholarly discussions. In Nepal, while AI adoption is still in its developing stages compared to the global landscape, its emergence signifies a growing part of daily life in the country. Understanding the basics of AI and its applications in Nepal is essential in grasping its evolving role within the nation. Nepal, renowned for its stunning landscapes and rich cultural heritage, is at the forefront of transformative technological advancements, particularly in Artificial Intelligence AI. This central shift presents a landscape with opportunities and challenges that hold the potential to significantly shape the countrys trajectory. AI, often acclaimed as the Fourth Industrial Revolution, is swiftly spreading diverse sectors in Nepal, spanning from agriculture, healthcare, and education to finance. This technological wave is unlocking extraordinary potential, moving the nation toward a more technology-driven future. Advancements in Agriculture through AI Agriculture, the backbone of Nepals economy, is undergoing a revolution driven by AI adoption. AI tools aid in crop management, pest control, and resource optimization. Predictive analytics powered by AI enable informed decisions on planting cycles, weather forecasts, and soil quality, enhancing productivity and sustainability. This technology transforms farming practices, offering proactive solutions, reducing reliance on pesticides, and optimizing resource usage. It empowers farmers with predictive insights, reshaping traditional methods and contributing to economic growth in Nepal. Revolutionizing Healthcare with AI Integration In remote regions of Nepal, AI has become a pivotal tool in transforming healthcare accessibility. Through AI-powered telemedicine platforms, individuals in these distant areas can now receive diagnostic evaluations and consultations without the need to travel long distances. This advancement ensures that medical expertise is readily available and accessible to those who might otherwise struggle due to geographical constraints. Moreover, AI plays a significant role beyond immediate consultations. It contributes extensively to predicting diseases, discovering new drugs, and shaping personalized treatment plans for patients. These applications of AI technology have sparked a revolution in Nepals healthcare sector, enabling earlier detection of illnesses, more effective drug development, and the customization of treatment approaches based on individual patient needs. This transformative impact is gradually improving healthcare outcomes and narrowing the gap in medical services between remote regions and urban centers in Nepal. Reinventing Education through AI In Nepals education system, the integration of AI technology has significantly transformed the traditional learning experience. Through the utilization of AI-powered adaptive learning platforms, students now have access to customized educational resources and tools. These platforms utilize sophisticated algorithms to analyze individual learning patterns and preferences, eventually providing personalized content and assessments that align with each students needs. The primary goal of this innovative approach is to enhance learning outcomes by catering to the specific requirements of each learner. By delivering tailored educational materials, these AI-driven systems aim to address the diverse learning styles and paces of students, thereby fostering a more effective and engaging learning environment. By leveraging technology, these platforms can potentially reach remote areas and underserved communities, thereby bridging the gap in educational disparities and providing more equitable opportunities for learning. Overall, the infusion of AI in Nepals educational landscape represents a promising shift towards personalized and inclusive learning methodologies that strive to optimize learning experiences and improve educational outcomes for students across the country. Economic Opportunities and the Role of AI Companies in Nepal AI is significantly reshaping various industries and playing a crucial role in boosting economic prospects within Nepal. Both appearing startups such as Fusemachines Nepal and established companies like Paaila Technology are actively delving into AI-driven solutions. Their focus on innovative AI applications not only fuels creativity but also propels economic expansion. This flow in technological advancements isnt just limited to innovation; its creating job avenues and drawing substantial investments into Nepals rapidly growing tech landscape. As AI continues to evolve, its fostering an environment ripe for economic growth, presenting opportunities for employment, and encouraging investors to participate in Nepals burgeoning tech industry. The Evolution of AI in Nepal Nepals adoption of artificial intelligence AI is on the rise, although it mainly utilizes whats termed as weak AI, exemplified by applications such as Siri and Google Assistant found on smartphones. These technologies demonstrate basic AI functionalities and are widely used within the country. However, Nepal is undergoing a transformation in its approach to AI. Theres a noticeable shift, with educational institutions introducing specialized courses in AI, providing to the growing interest and demand for expertise in this field. Moreover, there are pioneering AI companies in Nepal that are spearheading initiatives and advancements in AI development. These companies are playing a pivotal role in driving innovation and progress in the world of artificial intelligence within the country. The gradual integration of AI-focused educational programs and the presence of leading AI companies signify Nepals increasing commitment to advancing AI technologies. This evolution suggests a growing recognition of the importance of AI and its potential impact on various sectors within Nepal, indicating a promising future for AI development and application in the country. Challenges and Ethical Considerations Yet, Nepal encounters difficulties in effectively overseeing the use of AI technology. The absence of thorough rules and regulations raises ethical issues, particularly regarding the protection of data, biases within algorithms, and unequal access to digital resources. Despite the promising vision outlined in Nepals Digital Nepal Framework, it lacks in-depth consideration regarding ethical aspects of AI. This deficiency highlights the urgent need for legislative reforms that can govern the deployment of AI more efficiently and ethically in the country. Towards a Balanced Future with AI Promoting AI usage in Nepal demands comprehensive regulations aligned with ethical considerations. Educating people about AI ethics is critical to reduce risks associated with unregulated AI adoption. Balancing technological advancement with ethical practices is crucial for AI to benefit society without compromising individual rights or creating discriminatory biases. To sum it up, Nepal stands at a crossroads in its AI evolution, requiring proactive measures to harness AIs potential while safeguarding ethical principles and individual rights. Striking a balance between technological innovation and ethical governance is pivotal for Nepals sustainable development and societal well-being in the AI-driven future. Our AI-focused curriculum equips students with practical knowledge and direct experience in AI applications across sectors like agriculture, healthcare, finance, and education. prompt: Summarize this general content: Highest Salary Paying AI Jobs in Nepal.  Sunway College
completion: Highest Salary Paying AI Jobs in Nepal. Posted on November 12, 2023January 26, 2024 by Simoli Desai The AI revolution is sweeping the world, and Nepal is no exception. As artificial intelligence continues to reshape industries and create new opportunities, the demand for skilled AI professionals in Nepal is skyrocketing. These professionals are at the forefront of innovation and enjoy some of the most attractive salaries in the job market. In this blog, well explore some of the highest-paying AI jobs in Nepal, shedding light on the lucrative opportunities that await talented individuals in this dynamic field. Artificial Intelligence AI in Nepal AIs impact on Nepals job market cannot be underestimated. It is both transforming existing roles and ushering in entirely new career opportunities. To succeed in this field, individuals must acquire advanced skills and knowledge, making it clear that AI is not merely trivial programming. A solid educational background and training are prerequisites, alongside proficiency in computer science and programming. Is AI a High-Paying Job? Without a doubt, AI is synonymous with high-paying jobs. AI professionals are highly sought after in todays job market, and their salaries reflect the value they bring to the industry. The demand for AI experts has driven up compensation, making AI one of the most financially rewarding career paths in Nepal. Following are the top high-salary AI jobs in Nepal, attracting talent from all over the country and promising a prosperous future for venturing into the world of artificial intelligence. Top High-Paying AI Jobs in Nepal Machine Learning Engineer Salary in Nepal: Machine Learning Engineers in Nepal can expect to earn between NPR 100,000 to NPR 400,000 per month. For seasoned professionals with substantial experience, the salary can go beyond NPR 600,000. Machine Learning Engineers play a pivotal role in AI development by creating and implementing machine learning algorithms and models. This task involves training, which is a high processor and computation-intensive aspect of machine learning. Given the complexity of this work, it demands the highest level of skill and training. Most Machine Learning Engineers hold advanced degrees in computer science, mathematics, or statistics. They often pursue further training through certification programs or masters degrees in areas such as machine learning, deep learning, or neural networks. Data Scientist Salary in Nepal: Data Scientists in Nepal can earn between NPR 150,000 to NPR 300,000 per month, with experienced professionals commanding higher salaries. Data Scientists are technology professionals who specialize in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to solve problems and drive decision-making within organizations. While not all are programmers, many write their applications. They frequently employ data mining, big data tools, and analytical techniques. Their insights derived from data help businesses improve sales, and operations, make informed decisions, and develop new products and services. Predictive modeling and data visualization are part of their toolkit, with some using machine learning to automate these tasks. Data Engineer Salary in Nepal: Data Engineers or Architects in Nepal typically earn between NPR 180,000 and NPR 350,000 per month. Data Engineers work with massive data sets, a fundamental aspect of AI. They are responsible for designing, building, testing, and maintaining complex data processing systems. These professionals typically work with big data tools like Hadoop, Hive, Spark, and Kafka. Advanced degrees in mathematics and statistics are often prerequisites for these roles, as they are crucial for designing, maintaining, and building data pipelines based on extensive data sets. Software Engineer Salary in Nepal: Software Engineers with AI skills in Nepal can expect monthly earnings ranging from NPR 120,000 to NPR 250,000, depending on experience and expertise. Software Engineers in the AI domain are responsible for various activities in the software development chain, including design, development, testing, and deployment. AI Software Engineers design, develop, test, and deploy applications related to machine learning, inference, natural language processing NLP, sensory input, cybersecurity, and intrusion detection. AI Research Scientist Salary in Nepal: AI Research Scientists in Nepal can command monthly salaries ranging from NPR 250,000 to NPR 500,000 or more. AI Research Scientists are computer scientists who specialize in studying and developing new AI algorithms and techniques. Their work involves developing and testing new AI models, collaborating with other researchers, publishing research papers, and presenting findings at conferences. While programming is a component of their work, a significant portion of their role involves research and innovation. AI Research Scientists typically hold graduate degrees and have a strong background in computer science, mathematics, and statistics. What factors impact the average salary of an AI professional? The average salary of an AI professional is subject to various factors that significantly impact earnings. Education, experience, geographic location, industry, and the specific job role all contribute to determining ones income in this field. Notably, experience stands out as one of the most influential elements affecting salary levels. The logic is simple: the more experience you accumulate as an AI engineer, the deeper your expertise becomes, and consequently, the higher your earning potential in this dynamic and evolving industry. AI for a Good Future Career AI isnt merely a good career; its a future-proof one. As AI continues to shape the world, the demand for AI professionals will only continue to grow. A career in AI offers high earning potential, job security, and the opportunity to contribute to the future of technology. Sunway College Kathmandu recognizes the importance of bringing up talent in this field, offering programs such as Data Science and Artificial Intelligence and BSc Hons Computer Science with AI that ensure students are well-prepared for the exciting journey that lies ahead. Join Sunway College Kathmandu and be the AI pioneer Nepal needs! Apply Now! completion: IELTS scholarships for 2 graduates: an amazing offer by Sunway Posted on February 24, 2023June 9, 2023 by admin The headline seems too good to be true, isnt it? No, its not clickbait. It is indeed true that you have this opportunity for up to 100 IELTS scholarships to study BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence based on your IELTS score. If you have successfully completed your 12th grade exam along with the IELTS International English Language Proficiency Test, then you are a prospective student to receive up to 100 IELTS scholarship based on your score. So, without wasting any seconds, apply now and grab this opportunity. The score part is described in detail below, so keep reading. Also, I will be referring to the IELTS score-based scholarships simply as IELTS scholarships. So, dont get confused; it is an IELTS score-based scholarship. If your to-be career profile says, I want to: study in my home country. study in my home country with a foreign degree. study a bachelors degree in computer science and artificial intelligence. study a bachelors degree in computer science and artificial intelligence with a professional paid placement. study computer science and artificial intelligence in Nepal with foreign degree and a 9-month paid placement. Have IELTS scholarships .. ahem what? Congratulations! We are a match. But how does it match? IELTS scholarships and Artificial Intelligence. Am I missing something here? Please allow me to put your misunderstanding to rest. First, you must understand the relationship between our computer science and artificial intelligence course and the English Proficiency Test. Our purpose The purpose of giving the IELTS scholarships is to assist and motivate individuals who have shown they are proficient in the English language and who wish to pursue further education. By taking this action, the college wants to encourage you to finish your degrees domestically rather than abroad. The scholarship amount will be based on the students IELTS scores, as follows: IELTS scoresIELTS scholarships on college semester fees6, with each band score of 5.530 scholarship6.5, with each band score of 640 scholarship 7, with each band score of 6.550 scholarship7.5, with each band score of 760 scholarship8, with each band score of 7.570 scholarship8.5, with each band score of 880 scholarship9, with each band score of 8.5100 scholarshipIELTS scholarships on the basis of IELTS score I am guessing you are wondering about the fee structure too. Whats more, you must have taken and passed the IELTS test within the last two years, so you must present documentation of your results in order to be eligible for the scholarship. The scholarship will be awarded to a small number of students and will be based on both academic excellence and financial need. Why English proficiency test? Because this is a UK degree and the criteria are established by Birmingham City University BCU. I want to be clear about why you should care about having strong academic English before I continue. Im assuming youve already completed an English proficiency test, so you already have a basic understanding of its significance. Firstly, Academic English is the language used in academic contexts including colleges, research facilities, and business conventions. It is a formal and specialized form of communication that is important for the academic and professional settings. Secondly, The importance of Academic English  Academic success depends on effective communication, and Academic English allows you as an academics to explain your ideas and discoveries in a precise and straightforward manner.  The preferred language in academic and professional situations is Academic English. It is a formal method of communication that exudes that you are competent and serious about your job.  A key component of career advancement in many academic domains is the publication of researches. You as a researcher must be able to convey your findings in academic English because this is the language used in the majority of academic journals and publications.  English is the most widely utilized language for academic communication on a global scale. You can interact productively with colleagues from other nations and cultures by utilizing academic English. In summary, academic English is essential for success in academic and professional settings. It allows you to communicate clearly and precisely, convey professionalism, publish your research, and communicate globally with colleagues from different countries and cultures. IELTS scholarships: A blessing in disguise Furthermore, this offer could be a blessing in disguise for those of you who have gone through visa rejection and are in a dilemma of whats next for me? This is clearly your chance to shine again by studying computer science and artificial intelligence at a 501-600 world-ranking university in Kathmandu, with this incredible scholarship. You must demonstrate your English proficiency with the BCU recognized English tests: IELTS TOEFL PTE; 6.0 Score with each band of 5.5. So, there you go. If you have passed your IELTSTOEFLPTE exam then you dont need to give any proficiency test to enroll in artificial intelligence. And the icing on the cake for IELTS-passed students is that now you have the added benefit of grabbing scholarships to study in your home country as well. In addition, let me give you a little brief on what it is so that you can also savor the benefit of the IELTS score based scholarships. What is IELTS? The International English Language Testing System IELTS is one of the most popular English proficiency testing systems if you are applying to a country whose native language is English. IELTS and similar proficiency systems are essential if you are going abroad to work, study, or migrate. The purpose of IELTS classes is all about assessing your ability to listen, read, write, and speak English. Also, you will be graded on a scale of 1-9. How long is IELTS class in Nepal? Depending on the institute and their rules, it can differ, but the ideal duration is 67 weeks. Some have accelerated classes too, which are completed faster. IELTS classes are typically 1 to 2 hours long every day of the week along with a mock test once a week. What is the cost of an IELTS course in Nepal? Again, this depends on the kind of institutes you are thinking of enrolling in. The price can go as high as Rs. 10,000 and some even provide on Rs.6000 including books and materials that you will need during your learning. Also, it is up to you to choose the best institution for you. Most significantly, the teacher needs to be extremely competent and able to instruct even the weakest pupil. To wrap things up on the IELTS scholarships, Being a high school graduate is one of the most difficult things in the world. Now, everyones prying eyes are on you. Your career, your goals, your subject, and your passion are all in question. Youre probably wondering, Home country or foreign country? We say, Why not both? Not everyone can ever be sure what they want to do in the future. So, if you appear to be interested in computer science and artificial intelligence, we are confident in our IELTS scholarships for you. Finally, this is a once-in-a lifetime opportunity, and scholarships are something almost all of us need. Therefore, apply for the IELTS scholarships and seize the day! After submitting the application, wait for evaluation. Our scholarship committee will carefully evaluate all applications submitted through the colleges website to identify deserving candidates based on merit. Additionally, applicants must demonstrate their English proficiency with the BCU recognized English Tests: IELTS 6.0 overall with 5.5 minimum in all bands In case of any confusion or if you have questions during the application process, please feel free to contact us directly through the provided contact details on our website. We are here to assist you. View this post on Instagram A post shared by Sunway College Kathmandu sunwaycollegektm Why is this Scholarship Notable? The Merit Based IT Scholarship in collaboration with DigiSchool is not just a financial assistance program, it is a way to access quality education and start a remarkable journey in the world of Information Technology IT. Scholarship for Bachelor Degree in Nepal: If your dream is to establish a career in the IT field and study in Nepal, the Merit Based IT Scholarship is for you. Posted in UncategorizedLeave a Comment on Study IT with up to 100 Scholarship in Nepal  Learn How! 10 Reasons to Study Data Science Posted on August 3, 2023August 3, 2023 by admin You are interested in Data Science but still dont have any idea or reason behind choosing Data Science! Dont worry because choosing Data Science as an undergraduate major can be a rewarding decision for several reasons. Here are ten compelling reasons why you should consider studying data science at the undergraduate level: High demand and career opportunities: Data science abilities are in increasing demand across sectors. A degree in data science gives up a wide range of job prospects in industries such as technology, finance, healthcare, marketing, and more. Interdisciplinary nature: Data science combines mathematical, statistical, computer science, and domain-specific knowledge concepts. It provides a well-rounded education that prepares you for various positions and allows you to engage in multidisciplinary projects. Problem-solving and analytical skills: Data science teaches you problem-solving and analytical abilities. Youll learn how to extract, clean, analyze, and understand vast and complicated datasets, allowing you to make data-driven choices and solve real-world challenges. Competitive edge: With the rising relevance of data-driven decision-making, having a degree in data science provides you with a competitive advantage in the employment market. Employers respect employees who can successfully deal with data and get insightful conclusions. Versatility and flexibility: Data science abilities are adaptable and transferable across domains. Posted on July 30, 2023July 30, 2023 by admin Generative AI revolutionizes the creative process by allowing humans to supervise while machines generate. This shift relieves us from tedious, risky, and challenging tasks, enabling us to concentrate on the core aspects of our work: vision, ideas, and purpose. It represents a transformative change in the future of employment. Importance of Generative AI Generative AI, like photography and celluloid film, represents an incredible creative revolution. It reduces the necessity for creative skill in painting or singing, just as photography emancipated us from relying entirely on artists to depict the truth. The influence of Generative AI goes beyond creativity, giving rapid access to clear information and the automatic development of varied material such as news stories, product descriptions, bespoke designs, music, visual effects, and more. It is redefining not only specialized professions as well as our view of work, as AI models increasingly aid with repetitive or computational activities in the manufacturing process. How is Generative AI different from other AI? In contrast to other forms of artificial intelligence, generative AI focuses on producing new material, whereas discriminative AI classifies existing data. Generative AI is used for picture production, video synthesis, language generation, and music composition. It is one of the subcategories of artificial intelligence that encompasses various activities done by AI systems. Reactive machines for self-driving cars, limited memory AI for weather forecasting, theory of mind for virtual customer assistance, narrow AI for personalized product suggestions in e-commerce, supervised learning for object identification, unsupervised learning for fraud detection in banking, and reinforcement learning for teaching machines to play games are all examples of these tasks. Generative AI encompasses several of these areas and continues to grow, with its primary goal being the production of new material, whether writing, graphics, or product suggestions. How Generative AI works? To recognize patterns and produce new results, generative AI employs techniques such as neural networks and deep learning algorithms. It learns the basic principles guiding the content by studying a vast dataset. It generates fresh data by sampling from a previously learned distribution. The model refines the output to fit the desired outcome through a process known as inference, making it more realistic and aligned with user preferences. Generative AI Models 1. Natural Language Model Natural Language Model is the most well-known model of Generative AI, with ChatGPT making headlines. The majority of the excitement around text-based Generative AI is centered on a model known as GPT-3. Its a language model created by OpenAI, a research group dedicated to the development and promotion of friendly AI. For example, while computers cannot understand language in the same way that humans can, natural language technologies are becoming more effective at identifying the context and meaning of phrases and words and converting them into suitable responsesand actions. 2. Generative Adversarial Networks GANs Generative Adversarial Networks GANs are a well-known form of Generative AI. GANs consist of a generator and a discriminator that work together to enhance the generators ability to generate realistic data. Over time, the generator improves its capacity to synthesize lifelike data, resulting in the creation of new items, assets, faces, and even people. GANs can be utilized for various applications, including generating natural features such as lightning, leaves, roots, eyes, and flowers, as well as seamlessly integrating humans with nature. Furthermore, in the context of financial fraud detection, GAN models can generate synthetic fraudulent transactions to train fraud detection algorithms. 3. VAE and Anomaly Detection Variational Autoencoders VAE are a major model used for anomaly identification. It entails training the model on a collection of normal data and then utilizing it to detect occurrences that deviate from the norm. VAE has applications in a variety of fields, including financial fraud detection, discovering defects in manufacturing processes, and detecting network breaches. For example, Google has used VAE to identify network attacks. Future Prediction Generative AI will continue to play a critical role in computer graphics, animation, and 3D modeling in the gaming, film, and marketing industries. It will also be employed in the next decade or so to improve virtual assistants and chatbots natural language understanding, allowing them to conduct complicated discussions. In the future, generative AI will help to create realistic simulations in sectors like architecture and engineering, create new materials and products in manufacturing and textile design, and aid in natural language production for news articles, novels, and movie screenplays. Conclusion In terms of utility and predictability, generative AI is similar to a camera, acting as a powerful instrument in the hands of people. Just like a camera performs reliably, generative AI follows the same pattern each time it is used. It enables people to use their skills to generate content, develop new solutions, and explore creative possibilities. Users may leverage the potential of generative AI to improve productivity, accelerate improvements, and stimulate discoveries by understanding and utilizing its consistent nature. Posted in UncategorizedLeave a Comment on All you need to know about BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Scope  Placements  Career How does the For You algorithm work in TikTok? Posted on October 13, 2022June 9, 2023 by admin Have you ever wondered how the TikTok algorithm work? Let us review and understand. TikTok is addictive. It is so addictive that 9 out of 10 users on TikTok use it daily for hours. How do we spend hours on TikTok, even if its a short-content platform? Lets understand how the TikTok For You algorithm works. We will also cover how the basic recommendation algorithm works. Working of TikTok For You Page Recommendation Algorithm Before going in depth on how the TikTok algorithm works, let us understand the metadata. Metadata is the data that provides information about the data. This data helps identify and categorize the content for various backend purposes. Metadata of TikTok Videos Hashtags Hashtags are a few phrases attached to the end of the captions so they can help the algorithm understand the content type. The video uploader usually chooses this. Hashtags are better for a new content creator because they help TikTok identify the type of content theyre uploading. Music TikToks are frequently associated with music. TikTok made a significant move by using copyrighted music as a streaming platform, allowing creators to attach sounds without fear of copyright infringement. The music we choose for a TikTok video categorizes it as well, making it one of the more important pieces of metadata. Content-Duration TikTok is slowly increasing its video content duration limit. The platform started with a 15-second video uploaded over 10 minutes today. The length of the video also categorizes it, making it metadata for a TikTok video. Creator The creator uploading the content is by far the most critical metadata to categorize TikTok videos. Similarly, other metadata such as uploaded time, location, date, and video quality are a few other examples of metadata for a TikTok video. Consumer Ratings on TikTok When a video is released, TikTok usually sends it to all of its active users at once, who are usually chosen based on the metadata of the video that they are watching. Implicit Ratings Implicit ratings are ratings that occur as a result of behavior and cannot be faked by the user. For example, ordering a product from an online store. A few implicit ratings for TikTok videos are: View Time: During the initial video shoot, TikTok closely monitors the average watch duration of the video. There is a trend of looping a TikTok video so that the end can be unnoticed; the clever creator does it so that the watch duration exceeds the actual content duration, signaling the TikTok algorithm. Video Skips: A video viewer usually skips a video when they dont like it. This can be an important signal for TikTok to stop recommending the video that has been skipped and instead recommend some other content category. Profile Visit When consumers like the video, they usually visit the creators profile. This can count as an implicit rating as the user is indicating that they like the creator and want to consume similar content. Explicit Ratings Explicit ratings are the ratings that the user explicitly creates, which means theres some effort in creating explicit ratings. For example, liking a TikTok video A few explicit ratings for TikTok videos are: Likes: The user usually double-taps when they like the content, this helps to increase the likes count for a video and helps the algorithm. Comments: A comment on a video can act as a powerful explicit rating if there is more time and effort required to do so. Shares: Shares are also one of the most powerful explicit ratings as it is one of the rarest ratings, and parallelly, it also creates more exposure for the content. How TikTok algorithm work in recommended videos? As we have understood all the following terms, now we can understand how TikTok algorithm work to recommended videos. Step 1: The user uploads the video, and TikTok takes a few minutes to understand the content based on metadata. Step 2: TikTok distributes the video to a few active users in order to collect preliminary consumption data. Step 3: TikTok typically suggests the video to users who are watching other similarly category videos based on implicit and explicit ratings for the video. Step 4: Unless and until the consumption results begin to decline, TikTok will continue to recommend videos to users. In conclusion, TikTok is a video-editing app that sends videos to a few active users to collect initial consumption results. Based on implicit and explicit ratings for the video, TikTok usually recommends the content to users who are consuming similar videos. Unless and until the consumption results begin to decline, TikTok will continue to recommend videos to users. A message from the Sunway Social media and its uses have spread like wildfire lately. People are out and about promoting themselves, their products and services, and their way of life, whether for business or personal reasons. This is what is seen as the new normal for many. The study of social media and its utilization is important for making the most of this powerful medium. A bachelors degree in the field of artificial intelligence would be too good to be true. And, indeed, it is true. If you want to see yourself as an expert digital marketer, then enrolling in the classes is an important step. Sunway has been one of the first colleges in Nepal to provide a bachelors degree in the field of artificial intelligence. Posted on July 30, 2023July 30, 2023 by admin Generative AI revolutionizes the creative process by allowing humans to supervise while machines generate. This shift relieves us from tedious, risky, and challenging tasks, enabling us to concentrate on the core aspects of our work: vision, ideas, and purpose. It represents a transformative change in the future of employment. Importance of Generative AI Generative AI, like photography and celluloid film, represents an incredible creative revolution. It reduces the necessity for creative skill in painting or singing, just as photography emancipated us from relying entirely on artists to depict the truth. The influence of Generative AI goes beyond creativity, giving rapid access to clear information and the automatic development of varied material such as news stories, product descriptions, bespoke designs, music, visual effects, and more. It is redefining not only specialized professions as well as our view of work, as AI models increasingly aid with repetitive or computational activities in the manufacturing process. How is Generative AI different from other AI? In contrast to other forms of artificial intelligence, generative AI focuses on producing new material, whereas discriminative AI classifies existing data. Generative AI is used for picture production, video synthesis, language generation, and music composition. It is one of the subcategories of artificial intelligence that encompasses various activities done by AI systems. Reactive machines for self-driving cars, limited memory AI for weather forecasting, theory of mind for virtual customer assistance, narrow AI for personalized product suggestions in e-commerce, supervised learning for object identification, unsupervised learning for fraud detection in banking, and reinforcement learning for teaching machines to play games are all examples of these tasks. Generative AI encompasses several of these areas and continues to grow, with its primary goal being the production of new material, whether writing, graphics, or product suggestions. How Generative AI works? To recognize patterns and produce new results, generative AI employs techniques such as neural networks and deep learning algorithms. It learns the basic principles guiding the content by studying a vast dataset. It generates fresh data by sampling from a previously learned distribution. The model refines the output to fit the desired outcome through a process known as inference, making it more realistic and aligned with user preferences. Generative AI Models 1. Natural Language Model Natural Language Model is the most well-known model of Generative AI, with ChatGPT making headlines. The majority of the excitement around text-based Generative AI is centered on a model known as GPT-3. Its a language model created by OpenAI, a research group dedicated to the development and promotion of friendly AI. For example, while computers cannot understand language in the same way that humans can, natural language technologies are becoming more effective at identifying the context and meaning of phrases and words and converting them into suitable responsesand actions. 2. Generative Adversarial Networks GANs Generative Adversarial Networks GANs are a well-known form of Generative AI. GANs consist of a generator and a discriminator that work together to enhance the generators ability to generate realistic data. Over time, the generator improves its capacity to synthesize lifelike data, resulting in the creation of new items, assets, faces, and even people. GANs can be utilized for various applications, including generating natural features such as lightning, leaves, roots, eyes, and flowers, as well as seamlessly integrating humans with nature. Furthermore, in the context of financial fraud detection, GAN models can generate synthetic fraudulent transactions to train fraud detection algorithms. 3. VAE and Anomaly Detection Variational Autoencoders VAE are a major model used for anomaly identification. It entails training the model on a collection of normal data and then utilizing it to detect occurrences that deviate from the norm. VAE has applications in a variety of fields, including financial fraud detection, discovering defects in manufacturing processes, and detecting network breaches. For example, Google has used VAE to identify network attacks. Future Prediction Generative AI will continue to play a critical role in computer graphics, animation, and 3D modeling in the gaming, film, and marketing industries. It will also be employed in the next decade or so to improve virtual assistants and chatbots natural language understanding, allowing them to conduct complicated discussions. In the future, generative AI will help to create realistic simulations in sectors like architecture and engineering, create new materials and products in manufacturing and textile design, and aid in natural language production for news articles, novels, and movie screenplays. Conclusion In terms of utility and predictability, generative AI is similar to a camera, acting as a powerful instrument in the hands of people. Just like a camera performs reliably, generative AI follows the same pattern each time it is used. It enables people to use their skills to generate content, develop new solutions, and explore creative possibilities. Users may leverage the potential of generative AI to improve productivity, accelerate improvements, and stimulate discoveries by understanding and utilizing its consistent nature. IELTS and similar proficiency systems are essential if you are going abroad to work, study, or migrate. The purpose of IELTS classes is all about assessing your ability to listen, read, write, and speak English. Also, you will be graded on a scale of 1-9. How long is IELTS class in Nepal? Depending on the institute and their rules, it can differ, but the ideal duration is 67 weeks. Some have accelerated classes too, which are completed faster. IELTS classes are typically 1 to 2 hours long every day of the week along with a mock test once a week. What is the cost of an IELTS course in Nepal? Again, this depends on the kind of institutes you are thinking of enrolling in. The price can go as high as Rs. 10,000 and some even provide on Rs.6000 including books and materials that you will need during your learning. Also, it is up to you to choose the best institution for you. Most significantly, the teacher needs to be extremely competent and able to instruct even the weakest pupil. To wrap things up on the IELTS scholarships, Being a high school graduate is one of the most difficult things in the world. Now, everyones prying eyes are on you. Your career, your goals, your subject, and your passion are all in question. Youre probably wondering, Home country or foreign country? We say, Why not both? Not everyone can ever be sure what they want to do in the future. So, if you appear to be interested in computer science and artificial intelligence, we are confident in our IELTS scholarships for you. Finally, this is a once-in-a lifetime opportunity, and scholarships are something almost all of us need. Therefore, apply for the IELTS scholarships and seize the day! The platform provides easy access to targeted audiences, making it the most effective digital marketing tool. This form of marketing creates awareness, recognition, and interaction between customers and brands. Why is Social Media Marketing Important in 2023? There are many reasons to use social networking sites but most of these are directly or indirectly related to promotion and branding. Social media marketing is part of a corporate marketing plan that contributes more to your marketing and sales than any other marketing medium. It is a platform to engage with your friends and family. Based on similar reasons that individuals use their social handles, here are some reasons to use them for your marketing campaign: Tell your brands story Connect with your audience Analyze customers and competitors Promote your brand, product, and services with ads Social Media Marketing For Storytelling About Your Brand Social media is a platform where your presence can help you build your brand. Your online interaction with your customers allows you to tell your brand story and build trust. Regular content postings on such platforms give your brand more exposure and slowly introduce it to a broader audience. Building A Connection With Your Audience Regular engagement builds a strong connection between you and your customers. It helps them prioritize your product and service over other brands as they are more attached to you and are aware of your product and policies. Connection with your audience helps you grow your business, improve product quality, and gain valuable feedback. Social Media Marketing for Analyzing Customers and Competitors You can learn your customers purchase behaviors, including the topics that interest them. It will help you improve your product and marketing strategies. Promoting Your Brand, Product, and Services with Ads All popular social platforms have paid marketing features. You can use your existing audience on the platform to target them with personalized ads or target similar audiences. Content Marketing As Part Of Social Media Marketing Marketers use content marketing as a part of their marketing strategy to improve the brand customers trust and credibility. It involves using a variety of engaging content formats, such as blogs, articles, videos, infographics, posts, and more which engages and aware the audience regarding the brands products and services. Final Words In a nutshell, Social Media Marketing is crucial for leveraging the business platform and inducing growth. Social Media Marketing can be done by setting up an in-house team or by hiring an external marketing agency; however, big corporations have both in-house teams as well as work with external marketing agencies. Wizonbiz Digital and Many more To set up an in-house team, it is important to recruit marketers that are technically and academically qualified. All you need to know about BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Scope  Placements  Career Posted on November 6, 2022June 9, 2023 by admin BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Overview Sunway College Kathmandu in academic partnership with Birmingham City University BCU, offers BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence. Let us have complete information about our computer science and artificial intelligence course, its syllabus, scope, career, salary, and placement. What is BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence? Artificial Intelligence is the simulation of human intelligence processes by machines, especially computer systems. Artificial Intelligence is a complicated field of study, but you can become an expert in one of its subfields with the right amount of learning, guidance, and training. Why BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence? The BscHons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence degree provides you with a broad understanding of Machine Learning, AI, and Neural Networks. The program also prepares you with concepts like computer programming, database, data analysis, visualization, data structure and algorithms, and cyber security. This makes you a skilled and competitive candidate for a data science job. This course gives you hands-on experience in the artificial intelligence and data science field before you graduate. To ensure you get real experience of the workspace we have incorporated industry internship in our program. We work closely with industrial partners to safeguard your internship program. The right time to pursue an Artificial Intelligence career The recent advances in digitization have made Artificial Intelligence a very promising field. Why? Because we have access to the right resources and tools for extracting information from the data using various AI algorithms. BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence  Eligibility Criteria and Entrance Exams To be an AI expert requires a great logical understanding and AIML concepts. You need to learn computer programming and understand machine learning, and some major artificial intelligence tools and techniques. Our eligibility criteria to join a data science course is pretty straightforward. Youll need at least a GPA of 3.0 in your 2 or equivalent degree to qualify for this course. We will take a brief entrance exam that helps us understand your interest and your understanding of computer programming and data science. BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Syllabus and Subject Our BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence program provides you with a complete understanding of every Artificial Intelligence concept. A solid academic foundation in Machine learning and AI tools is combined with in-depth digital expertise in real-world projects? And an incorporated internship in our program with our MoU partners so you can adapt and experience working in the full-fledged AI expert team. Our 9 months of professional placement will for sure help you become industry ready before you graduate. Still not sure if you will make it into the Artificial Intelligence Program? Well, we can help you decide for yourself. How do I know I am made for BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence? You may find yourself confused by a range of possible career options, but we have compiled a list of tips that can help you identify if youre suited to the field of artificial Intelligence. You love Mathematics and Analytics A better mathematician is better at creating and optimizing logic. You definitely also like to analyze insights, work with probabilities, and perform other similar logical tasks. You already know how to code or youre learning If you already understand object-oriented programming and database concepts, or learn them. You are already preparing for a good data career ahead. You think easy solutions to complicated problems A better data scientist is one who can solve complicated problems with algorithms and data science. If you can think of a solution to tough problems, data science is for you. You are thrilled with AI and Machine Learning Most importantly, if you want to talk about AI and machine learning every time and everywhere, you are made for data science. Skill Sets Required for Pursuing Artificial Intelligence Career Interested in pursuing a career in artificial intelligence? Weve compiled a list of the skills that matter most. Programming Skill Programmingcoding is a primary skill to work in data science. You are required to learn one of the programming languages such as Python or R to get valued at a data science job interview. Data Warehousing and ETL tools. As a data engineer, youll deal with a massive amount of data. Youll need to use a data warehousing service to store and analyze such data. ETL Extract Transform Load tools help you to extract data from multiple sources to store it in your data warehouse. So, Data Warehouse and ETL tools are important to learn. Database Systems This again comes to data. You must understand multiple database systems. Youll need to run different database queries to extract or filter out data from a big pool of collected data. Understanding SQL and NoSQL-based databases is a must to work in a data science field. Data Analytics You must know how to analyze data to extract information from it. As a data scientist, you must know how to use industry data analytics tools. Understanding of Machine Learning As a data scientist, you use machine learning to build data models and analyze the data statistically. Even if you work as a data engineer, a brief understanding of how machine learning works can help you work efficiently with the team. Critical thinking for a Solution Data science is followed to get a solution to the problem through analyzing the data. You should develop a habit of thinking of a solution. You should know how to choose different dimensions of data points that can solve the problem most efficiently. Multiple Operating System As a data engineer, youll work with multiple sources of data, software, IoT devices, and cloud servers. Therefore, its good to have experience using operating systems like Linux, Windows, and Mac OS. Data Engineering Educational Backgrounds A data engineering academic background is preferred but not a compulsion to work in a data science field. You can also work on various open-source personal projects to prove your skills if you dont want to follow the academic route to work in the data science field. BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence: Scope and Top Recruiters Similar to a digital marketing career, there is an immense scope of data science and artificial intelligence. There is the freedom to work in any industry, anytime and anywhere as a data scientist. Every commercial company requires decision-making. Every large corporation, nonprofit, bank, eCommerce, shopping mall, school, or college regularly conducts meetings and planning. The companys growth is very dependent on the decisions. You as a data scientist help suggest a decision based on facts. Youll approach a solution supported by data and machine learning outcomes, that will give the optimum result. As a data scientist, you can work in any data company, or in a data team in any company. At present, while writing this blog, there are over 100 open vacancies for the data team. And trust us again, every great tech company is looking to hire a quality data expert. Data Science: Job Profiles and Salary The salary of a Data Scientist varies from location to location and experience wise. However, there is no limit if one has the potential to deliver. Data Scientists in Nepal are likely to observe a salary increase of approximately 8 every 29 months. Top Artificial Intelligence and Data Science Recruiters in Nepal Artificial Intelligence and Data Science is an emerging IT sector in Nepal, as it is one of the priorities for every innovative tech company. Some of the tech companies as well as corporate houses that recruit data science professionals are : Cotiviti Nepal LIS Nepal Pvt. Ltd OmnicomMediaGroup Nepal Brainnest Verisk Nepal Pvt. Ltd Fusemachines GrowByData Moonlit Solutions Alphateds Kharpann Keiv Technology Extenso Data Data Science and Artificial Intelligence Scope Abroad AI  Data science are one of the highest-paid fields in abroad countries. A good data scientist can earn over 300k yearly, which is considered a top income in a corporate job. The demand is rising and similar companies are expanding worldwide to create a big scope and crisis for data scientists. For the interested ones, there is no reason not to pursue a data science career. Final Words This course is designed to equip students with the ability to understand and apply data science in the real field to bring the required marketing objective. As a result, this dynamic course helps you learn all the skills that are essential in an artificial intelligence and data science career, as a data scientist, data engineer, AI engineer, ML engineer and similar. Posted in UncategorizedLeave a Comment on All you need to know about BSc Hons Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Scope  Placements  Career How does the For You algorithm work in TikTok? Posted on October 13, 2022June 9, 2023 by admin Have you ever wondered how the TikTok algorithm work? Let us review and understand. TikTok is addictive. It is so addictive that 9 out of 10 users on TikTok use it daily for hours. How do we spend hours on TikTok, even if its a short-content platform? Lets understand how the TikTok For You algorithm works. We will also cover how the basic recommendation algorithm works. Working of TikTok For You Page Recommendation Algorithm Before going in depth on how the TikTok algorithm works, let us understand the metadata. Metadata is the data that provides information about the data. This data helps identify and categorize the content for various backend purposes. Metadata of TikTok Videos Hashtags Hashtags are a few phrases attached to the end of the captions so they can help the algorithm understand the content type. The video uploader usually chooses this. Hashtags are better for a new content creator because they help TikTok identify the type of content theyre uploading. Music TikToks are frequently associated with music. TikTok made a significant move by using copyrighted music as a streaming platform, allowing creators to attach sounds without fear of copyright infringement. The music we choose for a TikTok video categorizes it as well, making it one of the more important pieces of metadata. Content-Duration TikTok is slowly increasing its video content duration limit. The platform started with a 15-second video uploaded over 10 minutes today. The length of the video also categorizes it, making it metadata for a TikTok video. Creator The creator uploading the content is by far the most critical metadata to categorize TikTok videos. Similarly, other metadata such as uploaded time, location, date, and video quality are a few other examples of metadata for a TikTok video. Consumer Ratings on TikTok When a video is released, TikTok usually sends it to all of its active users at once, who are usually chosen based on the metadata of the video that they are watching. Implicit Ratings Implicit ratings are ratings that occur as a result of behavior and cannot be faked by the user. For example, ordering a product from an online store. A few implicit ratings for TikTok videos are: View Time: During the initial video shoot, TikTok closely monitors the average watch duration of the video. There is a trend of looping a TikTok video so that the end can be unnoticed; the clever creator does it so that the watch duration exceeds the actual content duration, signaling the TikTok algorithm. Video Skips: A video viewer usually skips a video when they dont like it. This can be an important signal for TikTok to stop recommending the video that has been skipped and instead recommend some other content category. Profile Visit When consumers like the video, they usually visit the creators profile. This can count as an implicit rating as the user is indicating that they like the creator and want to consume similar content. Explicit Ratings Explicit ratings are the ratings that the user explicitly creates, which means theres some effort in creating explicit ratings. For example, liking a TikTok video A few explicit ratings for TikTok videos are: Likes: The user usually double-taps when they like the content, this helps to increase the likes count for a video and helps the algorithm. Comments: A comment on a video can act as a powerful explicit rating if there is more time and effort required to do so. Shares: Shares are also one of the most powerful explicit ratings as it is one of the rarest ratings, and parallelly, it also creates more exposure for the content. How TikTok algorithm work in recommended videos? As we have understood all the following terms, now we can understand how TikTok algorithm work to recommended videos. Step 1: The user uploads the video, and TikTok takes a few minutes to understand the content based on metadata. Step 2: TikTok distributes the video to a few active users in order to collect preliminary consumption data. Step 3: TikTok typically suggests the video to users who are watching other similarly category videos based on implicit and explicit ratings for the video. Step 4: Unless and until the consumption results begin to decline, TikTok will continue to recommend videos to users. In conclusion, TikTok is a video-editing app that sends videos to a few active users to collect initial consumption results. Based on implicit and explicit ratings for the video, TikTok usually recommends the content to users who are consuming similar videos. Unless and until the consumption results begin to decline, TikTok will continue to recommend videos to users. A message from the Sunway Social media and its uses have spread like wildfire lately. People are out and about promoting themselves, their products and services, and their way of life, whether for business or personal reasons. This is what is seen as the new normal for many. The study of social media and its utilization is important for making the most of this powerful medium. A bachelors degree in the field of artificial intelligence would be too good to be true. And, indeed, it is true. If you want to see yourself as an expert digital marketer, then enrolling in the classes is an important step. Sunway has been one of the first colleges in Nepal to provide a bachelors degree in the field of artificial intelligence. If contents like how the TikTok algorithm works catch your attention, then I bet terms like data science and artificial intelligence would certainly do too. More on this later. So, keep an eye on the blog. Posted in UncategorizedLeave a Comment on How does the For You algorithm work in TikTok? prompt: Summarize this general content: February 2025 - Sunway College Kathmandu
completion: Month: February 2025 How Nepals Social Media Council Bill, 2081 BS Could Impact Students: A Closer Look Posted on February 21, 2025February 21, 2025 by admin In a move that has sparked significant discussion across various sectors, the Nepalese government recently presented the Social Media Council Bill, 2081 BS in the National Assembly. Tabled by the Minister for Communications and Information Technology, Prithvi Subba Gurung, the Bill aims to regulate the growing use of social media platforms, holding users and operators accountable for their actions. While the government cites its goal of promoting social goodwill, cultural tolerance, and good governance, there are growing concerns about how this Bill will impact students, particularly in terms of their freedom of expression and online engagement. Understanding the Social Media Council Bill, 2081 BSThe bill seeks to establish clear guidelines for social media operators and users, focusing on ensuring a safe and secure digital environment. Among its key provisions, it outlines the following:Licensing for Digital Platforms: Companies or institutions operating digital platforms will need to obtain a license, valid for two years, to run social media sites in Nepal. Failure to comply with the regulations could lead to the revocation of their operating license. Content Regulations: The Bill targets cyberbullying, identity theft, misinformation, hate speech, deep fake videos, and other harmful digital behaviors. It also aims to control the spread of content that could jeopardize national peace, security, or sovereignty. Fines and Penalties: Users who engage in harmful online activities such as trolling, spreading false information, or engaging in online harassment could face fines of up to Rs 500,000. This would affect students who are active on social media platforms, potentially limiting their ability to express themselves freely. How Will This Affect Nepalese Students? Impact on Freedom of ExpressionOne of the main concerns about the bill is its potential effect on freedom of speech and expression. While the governments intention is to curb harmful content, such as hate speech and cyberbullying, there is worry that the broad nature of the regulations could also suppress legitimate expression. For students who use social media to engage in activism, academic discussions, or even personal expression, the fear of unwarranted censorship or punishment could lead to self-censorship and limited discourse online. Education and LearningMany students rely on social media platforms for educational content, online courses, webinars, and knowledge-sharing. However, the new Bills stringent content regulations could restrict access to certain types of content or make platforms overly cautious about the content they allow. Students who use YouTube, LinkedIn, and other social media for professional networking, learning, and career growth might find themselves limited by the need for companies to censor certain types of content to comply with the Bill. Online Privacy and Data SecurityOne of the Bills main selling points is its promise to improve information security, privacy of personal data, and cyber security. While this is an encouraging development, students will need to remain vigilant about their online footprint. The fear of stricter regulations could cause students to reconsider how much personal information they share on social media, which could have implications for those looking to build their online presence, especially for career networking or self-branding. Fines and AccountabilityWith fines of up to Rs 500,000 for users who engage in online activities deemed harmful, students may feel more apprehensive about their interactions on social media. The Bills broad scope, covering actions such as posting, liking, commenting, or tagging with the wrong intention, means that students could be penalized for actions that may seem innocuous or unintentional. This could make students more cautious, reducing their willingness to participate in conversations or share content freely. A Changing Social Media LandscapeThe implementation of the Social Media Council Bill will undoubtedly reshape the way social media operates in Nepal. With stricter regulations on digital platforms, students may find themselves navigating a more controlled online space. This could impact everything from group discussions, student activism, and university-related social media projects to career-building efforts on platforms like LinkedIn. It may also push students to look for new, alternative platforms to communicate or organize, especially if they feel stifled by existing social media regulations. Conclusion: Adapting to a New Digital EnvironmentAs Nepal moves forward with the Social Media Council Bill, students will need to adjust to the new reality of a more regulated digital space. While the intent of the Bill is to foster a safer, more secure online environment, students must stay informed about how the new regulations will affect their digital interactions. Understanding the implications of the Bill will help students protect their rights to freedom of expression, navigate the new rules on digital conduct, and continue using social media platforms in a responsible and creative way. completion: Month: January 2024 For AI Enthusiasts: A Fascinating Journey Through the History of Artificial Intelligence Posted on January 4, 2024February 14, 2025 by Simoli Desai Upon hearing the term Artificial Intelligence, many immediately picture familiar virtual assistants such as Alexa and Siri, advanced technologies like ChatGPT, or iconic portrayals from movies like The Terminator or TV series such as the Kdrama My Holo Love. These instances often align with a narrow but prevalent perspective on AI, encapsulating contemporary innovations and cultural references that shape the ongoing history of artificial intelligence. Artificial Intelligence AI isnt merely a futuristic idea confined to sci-fi realms; its a pervasive part of our everyday experiences. Whether its the personalized recommendations on streaming platforms like Netflix or the optimized routes suggested by ride-sharing services such as Pathao, AI permeates various aspects of modern life. This intricate ecosystem of interconnected technologies has steadily evolved over decades, contributing to its current complexity and ubiquity. Understanding the history of AI unveils a layered narrative, showcasing the diverse tools and capabilities that have molded it into the game-changing force it represents today. Tracing the trajectory of AIs development is key to comprehending its present importance and preparing for its future implications. By examining its origins and evolutionary path, we gain valuable insights into how AI has transformed from a conceptual idea into a transformative technology that profoundly influences our daily routines and shapes industries across the spectrum. grasping the past paves the way for harnessing the potential of AI in our ever-evolving world. History of Artificial Intelligence from Academic Roots to Practical Progress AIs origins lie within the academic halls of prestigious university research departments, initially pondered by scholars envisioning computings future. However, its infancy tethered it to these domains, hampered by scarce data and limited computational prowess. A pivotal moment arose in 1956 at Dartmouth College, where the renowned Dartmouth Summer Research Project on Artificial Intelligence convened. This workshop aimed to validate the notion that machines could simulate learning with precisiona groundbreaking hypothesis explored by 20 researchers. In subsequent years, significant strides marked AIs trajectory. American psychologist Frank Rosenblatts perceptron algorithm, born from Dartmouths research, demonstrated successful binary classification, offering glimpses into artificial neurons learning potential. Concurrently, John McCarthy, an attendee of the Dartmouth project, along with MIT students, pioneered Lisp, a novel programming language laying the groundwork for future advancements like the SHRDLU natural language program and others. The 1960s witnessed the emergence of Simulmatics, a company claiming to predict voting patterns based on demographics. By 1965, expert systems surfaced, allowing AI to tackle specialized problems using factual databases and inference engines. MIT professor Joseph Weizenbaums Eliza in 1966 showcased AIs intelligence by engaging users as pseudo-therapists, responding to their inputs with open-ended questions. However, by the mid-1970s, dwindling faith in AI among governments and corporations led to funding shortages, marking the onset of the AI winter. Despite brief revivals in the 1980s and 1990s, AI remained largely relegated to science fiction, steering clear of serious computer science discourse. It wasnt until the late 1990s and early 2000s that AI saw widespread adoption of machine learning techniques, including Bayesian methods from spam filtering by Microsoft and collaborative filtering for Amazon recommendations, marking a resurgence in AIs practical applications. AI in the 21st Century: Revolutionary Pilot Programs and Real-world Applications During the 2000s, a confluence of factors, including increased computing power, expansive datasets, and the ascent of open-source software, empowered developers to engineer advanced algorithms. This technological wave promised swift and transformative change across scientific, consumer, manufacturing, and business sectors within a remarkably brief period. Today, AI is an integral part of numerous business operations, attaining tangible reality. For instance, McKinseys research highlights a staggering 400 instances where companies actively leverage AI to tackle various business challenges. These real-world applications of AI exemplify its widespread adoption and effectiveness in addressing multifaceted business issues. Likewise, in the early to mid-2000s web revolution introduced significant changes to AI research. Foundational technologies like Extensible Markup Language XML and Googles PageRank altered data organization, facilitating AI integration. XML played a crucial role in shaping the semantic web and bolstering search engine capabilities, while PageRank redefined web organization. These innovations enhanced data accessibility for AI, rendering vast amounts of information more navigable. Simultaneously, database improvements in data storage and retrieval, alongside advancements in functional programming languages, streamlined data manipulation for developers and researchers. These combined tools provided a fertile ground for advancing AI technology. Artificial Intelligences Potential: Evolution through Neural Networks and Deep Learning AI held ambitious promises throughout the 20th century, yet limited computing power posed significant barriers to realizing these ambitions. However, as the 21st century dawned, computers underwent an exponential surge in capability, becoming proficient in storing, processing, and analyzing massive volumes of data. This paradigm shift paved the way for translating the ambitious goals of neural networks and deep learning into tangible realities. Researchers made strides by curating datasets explicitly tailored for machine training, culminating in the creation of neural networks like AlexNet. Unlike earlier methods reliant on datasets numbering in the tens of thousands, advancements in graphics processing units GPUs allowed for datasets to reach tens of millions, significantly enhancing machine learning capabilities. In 2006, Nvidia, a leading computer chip manufacturer, introduced CUDA, a parallel computing platform that harnessed the power of GPUs to drastically accelerate computational speeds. This monumental leap facilitated the execution of large, intricate machine-learning models through platforms such as TensorFlow and PyTorch, propelling innovation in the field. As these platforms evolved into open-source libraries, they democratized AI, enabling widespread experimentation. This democratization empowered the inception and growth of groundbreaking tools like AlphaGo, Google DeepMind, and IBM Deep Blue, fostering an era of exciting advancements in artificial intelligence.
